descriptions: Teams net points while player is on the court.
Teams net points while player is on the court.

article.description: Sam Cassell celebrated his new contract extension with 29 points, 10 assists and seven rebounds, leading the Milwaukee Bucks to a 107-103 victory over the Memphis Grizzlies.
article.headline: Cassell earns his money with 29 against Grizzlies

images.name: Allen, Ray 020207 inline
images.caption: Ray Allen, who tied for team-high honors with 29 points, corrals a loose ball.

article.linkText: Bucks cash in against Grizzlies with Cassell's 29 points on payday
article.story:
MILWAUKEE (AP) -- Sam Cassell took his big payday and his big night in stride. "I play basketball, the money doesn't matter," Cassell said after scoring 29 points, including the game-clinching free throw in Milwaukee's 107-103 victory over the Memphis Grizzlies Thursday night. Cassell added 10 assists and seven defensive rebounds just hours after signing a three-year, $17 million extension that both sides agreed didn't match his worth. "I'm still underpaid," said Cassell, who got the best contract he could under terms of the collective bargaining agreement. Cassell said he signed it because his family wanted him to. "If I didn't sign it, I'd be leaving," Cassell said. "And then you won't have Sam Cassell, you won't have Jason Kidd, you won't have Gary Payton. You might end up with some other guy. George Karl would leave Milwaukee and then you're back to the old Bucks." For now, the Bucks still have a shot at winning the weak East. They enter the All-Star break atop the Central Division by one game over the Toronto Raptors. Although the Bucks have been inconsistent -- they had lost five of their previous six, including four of five at home -- they're 28-18 at the break. "If we can go 10 games above .500 in the second half, we'll have a great year," said Karl, who went off on his team Saturday as being too selfish and stubborn. Karl, who went so far as to suggest a trade or his own firing might be the solution, said he saw some of what he wanted: better passing and harder work. He still didn't like the defensive effort overall. "It ping-pong's back and forth. Sometimes it's passing, sometimes it's defense," he said. Although the game wasn't decided until Cassell's free throw with 2.8 seconds left, Milwaukee never trailed after the 4:43 mark of the second quarter. "It never has been easy," Karl said. "Always has been a team that plays with the game a little bit. But it also knows how to win games." Ray Allen also scored 29 points for the Bucks. Rookie Pau Gasol led the Grizzlies with 30 points, and Brevin Knight added a season-high 24. "He's playing well," Grizzlies coach Sidney Lowe said of Gasol. "I never would have imagined him to come in the league and play like he has." Cassell scored 19 points in the first half as the Bucks built a 61-50 lead on the strength of a season-best 42-point second quarter. The Grizzlies came back and tied it at 93 on Shane Battier's buzzer-beating 3-pointer with 3:51 left, setting up a frenzied final few minutes in which the West's worst team stayed right with the Central Division leader. Knight's basket made it 106-103 before Cassell was fouled on the inbounds and missed his first free throw. The Grizzlies scored the first 11 points of the game and led 29-19 after one quarter. The Bucks made 16 of their 21 shots in the second quarter, when Cassell made all five of his shots. And of their five misses, four were offensively rebounded, leading to nine second-chance points. Michael Redd added 15 points, giving Milwaukee's guards 73. "That's probably the strength of their team," Battier said. "When those guys are hitting, I don't know if there's a team in the East that can beat them."

Game notes
Memphis is one of three teams that are 0-3 against Milwaukee this season. The others are Atlanta and Indiana. ... Karl won his 150th game as Milwaukee's coach. He has lost 110 times with the Bucks. ... Milwaukee enters the All-Star break at 28-18, two wins shy of Karl's goal. ... The Grizzlies missed a chance to record a franchise-best 15th victory before the All-Star break.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
